ratings.comment: Great professor whose proficiency and passion for the material taught inspired me personally. Pretty accessible for questions outside of the classroom.

This guy is literally the best chem teacher I have ever had! His lectures are very interesting and he presents the material in a very clear way. Lots of points to boost your grade from pre class assignments and homework. Have I mentioned how hilarious and adorable this guy is?? Just a genuinely nice guy who cares about his students and chem!
I loved how informative his lectures are and how involved with the class he is

Professor Schmidt is a very clear and fair professor. I enjoyed how organized his lectures were and I thought that his tests were fair. I would definitely take a class with him again if I had the chance.
Professor Schmidt presented all information in a clear, concise, and conversational manner. He was consistent and had realistic expectations. The homework and tests were fair. Very organized.

Prof Schmidt did a good job of keeping a very large chem 103 class engaged. He is a good teacher (always available and cares for the students) and his grading policies are all very fair. Would definitely recommend him!

Prof Schmidt was amazing! He kept lectures interesting and gave you so many opportunities for points just for completion of things. Very helpful and lectures weren't boring at all! Take Schmidt if you can
Really good professor. His tests were not too bad and my TA Amy Tatarsky was really helpful. His lectures are very clear and he does a good job teaching the material properly.
Professor Schmidt was great in lecture. Test averages were around 70% (great compared to some classes). However, I think your success in this class really depends on the TA you have.
Prof. Schmidt is a great professor to have during your first semester of college. Loved his class, and good sense of humor so lectures don't get too boring.

Schmidt is an awesome professor. His subtle humor is great, he is very clear and simple with words, so I never lost him in his train of thought during the semester. The experiments he performs are great! Really get the classes attention back on lecture when he's blowing stuff up in class!

Schmidt is the best chem teacher Ive had! I had no idea what was going on in AP chemistry in high school but Schmidt really makes the material clear and easier to understand. Really enjoyed this class

JR was by far my favorite professor I had this semester! He is just a genuinely nice guy who seems like he really cares for his students. I had to miss an entire week of class for family reasons and he was totally understanding! Only problem is he basically teaches only through examples, which can be confusing. Overall, I really recommend him!

You can just tell Schmidt is a great person and that he really wants to help his students. But he doesn't organize his lectures very well, it is sometimes difficult to figure out what he is talking about because he pretty much only uses examples.
Seems like a hit or miss professor. Teaches by example a lot, meaning instead of explaining the general concept he'll jump right into an example, which I personally didn't like but some people did.

JR is awesome, if you are looking for a crystal clear professor for freshman year this is the way to go! Homework and Quiz grades count for completion and exams are moderate. Awesome Professor and great way to start off freshman year!

JR is awesome. He's very interested in his students and works to help everybody get good grades. Very fair grader, course requires hard work to get good grades, however. Definitely recommend JR to anyone taking Chem.

Literally obsessed with JR! He's so like nerdy and adorable in the best possible way. He's constantly blowing stuff up and doing cool demos in class so it keeps things interesting! Definitely a very fair professor; I studied really hard and got an A in the course, but his curve is definitely nice too. Wish he taught 104 :(
I like JR a lot! His class was a bit boring, but not terrible! Study well and you'll do well! :)

Mixed feelings about him. He seemed like he wanted everyone to do well in class, but there were a couple questions on exams that weren't anything we covered in lecture. The curve was nice, but I'd rather have an exam that more directly followed the problem sets with no curve than an exam in which the average is a 50% and a huge curve.
Extremely hard tests and doesn't make sense at all in lecture.  Tested on different material than in discussion and not even the TAs fully understood him.
I found his tests to be challenging personally, but the curve is very helpful. Textbook is pointless to read, online homework is the most helpful thing. Sofia Erazo worst TA

His class is actually fun to go to because he is constantly doing demos and cracking corny joke. I ended up getting a B cause i screwed up on 1 test and did mediocre on the final. If you stay on top of your stuff and do practice problems you can get an A.

Nice guy, easy exams, easy class. Only complaint: he oftentimes didn't speak loudly enough to be heard in the back, especially with idiots in the class being loud. (If you're any good at chemistry, take Chem 109 instead.)

Very fun and easy to understand. I'm personally bad at math and I came out just fine. He's very intelligent but makes lectures engaging, constantly blowing things up, which always makes you pay attention. Exams were multiple choice and very fair, the curve extremely easy. TAs were great too. This man was the best prof I had all year.
